[Adiitu]188-adiitu - [Olodumare]188-adiitu 's Wonderful Dream Those were the things that [Adiitu]188-adiitu wrote on a page of the register of [one of those that had died but were serving as [servants in heaven]1600-servants in heaven]1599-one of those that had died but were serving as servants in heaven . As [he]188-adiitu finished writing this down , [he]188-adiitu looked ahead and saw hens , ducks , goats , sheep , pigeons and numerous domestic animals in an orderly row following [one another]357-one another gently . When [he]188-adiitu inquired , from someone where [they]1602-they were going , [he]188-adiitu was informed that [they]1602-they were going to line up [themselves]1602-they where [the Creator]4131-the creator ordered [them]1602-they to line up as it was time for morning praise worship to [Almighty God]107-god . Truly , in a short while later , songs began and all that were present started singing in praise of [God]107-god . [Doors]179-doors sang : windows sang , [the roads that [we]1605-we trod]1604-the roads that we trod sang , and [all the voices]1606-all the voices sang in [xmison]39-xmison . The melody of the song was beyond description . What was most marvelous of all was that [all the souls]1607-all the souls sang joyfully , amidst laughter and joy and it was crystaTclear that the joyful song came from the hearts and that [they]1607-all the souls .loved [God]107-god with all [their]1607-all the souls hearts . When [they]1607-all the souls were meant to shout , [they]1607-all the souls would shout very loudly . When [they]1607-all the souls were supposed to sing solemnly , [they]1607-all the souls would be solemn . The song was unmatchably melodious . After this , [Adiitu]188-adiitu saw [one of [[his]188-adiitu brothers]1609-his brothers that had died]1608-one of his brothers that had died . [He]188-adiitu was so happy to see [[his]188-adiitu yoimger brother]1610-his yoimger brother ’ and [he]188-adiitu desired to show [him]1610-his yoimger brother where [[his]1610-his yoimger brother father]3990-his father was but [he]188-adiitu said that [they]1607-all the souls would not go through [a straight road]4298-a straight road that led to where '[188-adiitu] [Obiri - aiye]94-obiri - aiye was because [he]188-adiitu wanted to show [him]1610-his yoimger brother a few things before [they]1607-all the souls got [there]616-there . If [they]1607-all the souls had wanted to get [there]616-there quickly , [he]188-adiitu would have instructed the glass on [the road [they]1607-all the souls were treading]1613-the road they were treading to take [them]1607-all the souls [there]616-there swiftly . The glass would have glided [their]1607-all the souls feet gently and [they]1607-all the souls would be there instantly . [[Adiitu]188-adiitu 's brother]1615-adiitu 's brother took [him]188-adiitu into [a big house]1616-a big house . [This house]1617-this house was bigger than [any house on [earth]3889-earth]1618-any house on earth . [The people of heaven]1539-the people of heaven called it [He]1617-this house Ope ( [House of Thanks]1621-house of thanks ) . [The house]405-the house , from foundation to [the

The Mysteries of God roof]1623-the the mysteries of god roof , had railings with a bag hung on each railing and the bags were named ' the bag of thanks '[180-apo ope] ( [Apo Ope]180-apo ope ) . Everybody on [earth]3889-earth had a bag of thanks . In those bags were deposited all the blessing that [each person]1512-each person had received on [earth]3889-earth . If [you]1627-you were rich , how many [people]379-people have [you]1627-you endowed with [your]1627-you riches and how many [people]379-people came to say thank [you]1627-you ? How many of [those people]995-those people were ingrates ? and that only [God]107-god remarked the kindness shown to [those people]995-those people . How many [people]379-people have [the person]722-the person given gifts on [earth]3889-earth ? — all these were kept ih the bag of thanks that were all hung on the wall . [Adiitu]188-adiitu entered [another mighty house]1635-another mighty house . [The house]405-the house was packed full of boxes lined up and called the labour of worship of [human beings]684-human beings . Whatever money [each person]1512-each person paid for worship purposes was used to purchase the clothes in each of the bags of worship and referred to as the heavenly clothes ( [Aso Orun]181-aso orun ) . All money paid by [each Christian]1639-each christian for church work , be it for the payment of [pastor]1640-pastor 's salary , building constructions , and payment for [other church workmen]1641-other church workmen were utilized in buying [Aso Orun]181-aso orun and kept in the boxes for [the person]722-the person . Whatever church work done by [anybody]3883-anybody was converted to money and kept for [him]3883-anybody in [heaven]319-heaven . Inside these boxes were kept somethings referred to as [Ako - Okuta - Orun]182-ako - okuta - orun ( white stones of heaven ) . That one grew like yam and was very heavy and it was a marker of the extent of the goodness of the character of [the person]722-the person because [someone]726-someone may be [a good church- goer]1647-a good church- goer and may be worse than [the devil]3922-the devil . Yet , [each person]1512-each person 's box ought to be heavy because it was the yardstick against which the type of heaven that [the person]722-the person would go after death would be measured . Once [a dead person]1651-a dead person got to the gates of [heaven]319-heaven , a heavy scale would be brought to measure [his]1651-a dead person sins against [his]1651-a dead person good deeds . [The Aso Orun]181-aso orun in [the

Adiitu - Olodumare]188-adiitu 's Wonderful Dream box were usually light , so if it was balanced on the scale against [his]1651-a dead person load of sin , it should go up the scale . [Ako - Okuta - Orun]182-ako - okuta - orun was what gave plenty of weight to good deeds . The box of church- work might be weighty while [the Ako - Okuta - Orun]182-ako - okuta - orun might be very small and thus , [its]182-ako - okuta - orun measurement would not weigh much . [Some people]1518-some people 's church work may not be more than three inches feet and one foot high yet its heavenly stones might be heavier than twenty bags of cocoa . The type of heaven that [one]3876-one would go might not be certain to [the person]722-the person at once . This is because , when [a person]433-a person died , [he]433-a person would be located in [a place imtil [God]107-god 's judgment came]1657-a place imtil god 's judgment came , yet [many people]1658-many people died several thousand years ago and [their]1658-many people judgments have not been passed . [Some of [the people who died recently]1660-the people who died recently]1659-some of the people who died recently had to go back to [another world that was worse than this]1661-another world that was worse than this [[our]1662-our earth]1663-our earth but which was not hell . When one thinks of how bad [this world]390-this world is , it will be inconceivable that one should go to [a worse earth]1665-a worse earth than [ours]1662-our , but it is a matter of character . If one behaved as well as [his]3876-one worship , certainly [his]3876-one virtuous , load should weigh heavier than [his]3876-one load of sin . If [one]3876-one contributed money , works hard and worships well to the recognition of all and simdry , the money paid on [him]3876-one will be used to purchase clothes and the box will be light . When [his]3876-one load of sin was put on balance , it would press [his]3876-one good deeds swiftly down on the scale . That was the , end for [that person]1667-that person . If the load of sin and goods were equally weighed , [the person]722-the person would go to the kind of heaven [we]1662-our have described which was better than [our]1662-our eardr a thousand and four himdred times . [Adiitu]188-adiitu - [Olodumare]188-adiitu 's Wonderful Dream As soon as [they]1676-they got out of [the place]1149-the place , [Adiitu]188-adiitu found [some people hawking food]1678-some people hawking food and [he]188-adiitu requested that [he]188-adiitu be taken to [them]1678-some people hawking food . \ \iSix f Adiitu Courts lyun - ade [Adiitu]188-adiitu had this puzzling dream in [Ifehinti town where [he]188-adiitu was performing the funeral rites of [[his]188-adiitu parents]605-his parents]1821-ifehinti town where he was performing the funeral rites of his parents but soon after , [he]188-adiitu went back to [Ajedubule town]1326-ajedubule town where [he]188-adiitu was residing . [Adiitu Courts Ivun - ade]188-adiitu SO beautiful at birth that the word ' iyun '[188-adiitu] had to supply the prefix of [her]1838-this girl name to become lyunade . Derision apart , [this lady]1839-this lady was [a beautiful woman]1840-a beautiful woman . [She]1839-this lady was light - skinned and fresh . [She]1839-this lady was not xmduly fat and not lanky . [She]1839-this lady was slim and fairly tall . All that makes [a lady]1841-a lady attractive could be found in [this lady]1839-this lady ; [her]1839-this lady eyeballs were crystal bright , not glowing red like the eyes of a snake . If [you]1835-you saw [her]1839-this lady forehead , [you]1835-you would conclude that [the Almighty]1763-the almighty made [hers]1839-this lady specially , with a slight black line . [Her]1839-this lady lips were not unduly thin yet not thick like a washbasin , [her]1839-this lady teeth were as white as the sky and [her]1839-this lady legs were not thin like a grasshopper 's legs yet they were not as thick as the elephant 's . The head was neither shapeless nor flat nor oblong . [The Creator]189-the creator made it moderate and fitting . When [you]1835-you behold lyun ­ ade from the front , [she]1839-this lady will attract [you]1835-you , if [you]1835-you admire [her]1839-this lady from the rear , [you]1835-you will desire [her]1839-this lady . [She]1839-this lady walked [the earth]345-the earth with stealth , gliding with dignified ease . Just as [the Almighty]1763-the almighty endowed [her]1839-this lady with physical beauty , so did [he]1763-the almighty endow [her]1839-this lady with natural grace . If [she]1839-this lady tied an aran shawl , it would sit well on [her]1839-this lady , if [she]1839-this lady tied a common cloth , it would be good to look at , not to talk of [her]1839-this lady wearing aran or damask . Ah ! [God]121-god created [her]1839-this lady without a blemish ; [she]1839-this lady talked gently , laughed gracefully , and [she]1839-this lady did not talk without thought , not like women who talk like [men]950-men , howling like the monkey on the tree . [God]121-god did not leave a bad spot on [the girl]1847-the girl . Moreover , [the father]581-the father was well - to - do , and [the mother]560-the mother was comfortable . [She]1839-this lady was [a sibling of [Ademeto]187-ademeto whom [she]1839-this lady loved without comparison as [he]187-ademeto could do just anything that [she]1839-this lady demanded for [her]1839-this lady]1850-a sibling of ademeto whom she loved without comparison as he could do just anything that she demanded for her . The second year that [Adiitu]188-adiitu got to [Ajedubule]34-ajedubule was the year [lyimade]190-lyimade travelled . [She]190-lyimade returned after four years and it was during the period that [she]190-lyimade was away that [Adiitu]188-adiitu and [Ademeto]187-ademeto

The Mysteries of [God]121-god became [friends]1223-friends . From the very day that [Adiitu]188-adiitu set eyes on [lyun- ade]191-lyun- ade , love enveloped [him]188-adiitu like a hen envelopes [her]190-lyimade chicks . If love falls on one , it would get up , if it intoxicate one , it would clear . If love 's epilepsy feat caught one , it would die down but whosoever love envelopes is in trouble . [Adiitu]188-adiitu was so completely enveloped by love that [he]188-adiitu could no longer spare any thought for any other matter aside lyunade . If [anybody]3883-anybody passed by , [he]188-adiitu would quickly steal a glance just in case it was [her]191-lyun- ade and if [anybody]3883-anybody was coming from behind , [he]188-adiitu would cast a backward glance thinking [she]191-lyun- ade was [the one coming]1854-the one coming . There was no other thought on [his]188-adiitu mind than the thought of lyun - ade . [He]188-adiitu had a difficulty , as [a prominent man m [the town]464-the town]1855-a prominent man m the town , to discuss romantic issues with just [anyone]1270-anyone and [[his]188-adiitu friend]1320-his friend and confidante , [Ademeto]187-ademeto left [town]881-town on a week journey the day after [Adiitu]188-adiitu beheld [lyun - ade]1860-lyun - ade . Before [Ademeto]187-ademeto , arrived ; however , [Adiitu]188-adiitu had taken a. step . [His]188-adiitu thinking was that , given [his]188-adiitu wealth and prosperity which made anything [he]188-adiitu said taken with importance , [lyun - ade]1860-lyun - ade would consider it an honour that [he]188-adiitu could even be thinking of [her]1860-lyun - ade for marriage . So [he]188-adiitu wrote [her]1860-lyun - ade a letter . This was the content , of the letter : Opopoigbadun , [Ajedubule]34-ajedubule , 24*^ August , 1958 . [[My]0-i beloved]512-my beloved [lyun - ade]192-lyun - ade , [I]0-i have something to tell [you]192-lyun - ade and [I]0-i am certain that it will please [you]192-lyun - ade very much . [I]0-i would have waited for [Ade]192-lyun - ade ( a short for [Ademeto]187-ademeto ) but [I]0-i felt it was better for [me]0-i to settle the matter beforehe arrived . r # # # 86 ' % '[192-lyun - ade] VVl ■ - , y;'.r # # #

[Adiitu Courts Ivun - ade]188-adiitu [I]0-i want [you]192-lyun - ade to meet [me]0-i at nine o'clock five days from today in one of [[my]0-i houses]1347-my houses which [you]192-lyun - ade should name ; whether it is [[my]0-i ten - storey building house]1864-my ten - storey building house , or [the eight - storey one which [I]0-i built for thirty thousand pounds or the five - storey house built for twenty - thousand pounds]1865-the eight - storey one which i built for thirty thousand pounds or the five - storey house built for twenty - thousand pounds . Then , [I]0-i want [you]192-lyun - ade to name [the kind of pleasure car that [I]0-i should send to bring [you]192-lyun - ade]1866-the kind of pleasure car that i should send to bring you ; either [[my]0-i small car bought for three thousand pounds]1867-my small car bought for three thousand pounds or the one that is a little bigger worth six thousand pounds or even the very big one worth ten thousand pounds . This is the end of [my]0-i message . [I]0-i remain [yours]192-lyun - ade till [my]0-i dying day , [Adiitu Olodumare]188-adiitu That was how [Adiitu]188-adiitu wrote [his]188-adiitu letter and [I]0-i want [you]192-lyun - ade to take note of the elements of pride in the letter . In the first place , [he]188-adiitu had scarcely made the acquaintance of [lyim - ade]193-lyim - ade and [he]188-adiitu was already calling [her]193-lyim - ade ' [[My]188-adiitu beloved]512-my beloved l5am - ade '[188-adiitu] . Upon all , what was [I)uin - ade]194-i)uin - ade 's business with the costs of [[his]188-adiitu houses]1869-his houses and [cars]1870-cars ? After considering all these , [lyun - ade]192-lyun - ade paid [Adiitu]188-adiitu in [his]188-adiitu own coins . [She]192-lyun - ade gave [him]188-adiitu a one - line answer : Dear [Adiitu]188-adiitu , [I]0-i can not meet [you]188-adiitu as [you]188-adiitu said , lyun - ade

The Mysteries of [God]121-god When [Adiitu]188-adiitu saw this one - line response , [he]188-adiitu sank down on [his]188-adiitu buttocks . It was as if [someone]726-someone carried [him]188-adiitu up and smashed [his]188-adiitu back on the groimd , then began to drag [him]188-adiitu around . [Adiitu]188-adiitu was greatly worried , especially since [the girl]1847-the girl 's love was topmost on [his]188-adiitu mind and what [he]188-adiitu considered important was a mere trivia in the sight of [the lady]1873-the lady . [Adiitu]188-adiitu was greatly disturbed throughout that day . If [he]188-adiitu wanted to talk to [[his]188-adiitu servants]1874-his servants , it was done by shouting at [them]1874-his servants . [He]188-adiitu could not eat , [he]188-adiitu could not swallow a morsel and there was [no one]3915-no one [he]188-adiitu could confide in beside [Ademeto]187-ademeto , [[the lady]1873-the lady 's brother]1877-the lady 's brother , who was away and was yet to return . On the day [Ademeto]187-ademeto was to arrive , [Adiitu]188-adiitu sent messages to [[his]188-adiitu house]528-his house almost ten times and each time [he]188-adiitu asked that [he]188-adiitu should make sure [he]188-adiitu came to see [him]188-adiitu as soon as [he]188-adiitu arrived . It was already dark by the time [Ademeto]187-ademeto arrived but as soon as [he]187-ademeto got the messages , [he]187-ademeto headed straight for [[Adiitu]188-adiitu 's place]1879-adiitu 's place and [he]188-adiitu was totally surprised that [[his]188-adiitu friend]1320-his friend had shrunk so much . On entering , [he]188-adiitu shouted , ' Ha ! [[My]188-adiitu friend]3880-my friend , is anything the matter ? '[188-adiitu] [Adiitu]188-adiitu said , ' There is nothing , yet there is something , let [us]1881-us go inside [the room]607-the room . '[188-adiitu] Once [they]1881-us entered [the room]607-the room , [Adiitu]188-adiitu said , ' [Ademeto]187-ademeto , [I]188-adiitu am telling [you]187-ademeto , love has enveloped [me]188-adiitu . '[188-adiitu] [Adiitu]188-adiitu replied . [Ademeto]187-ademeto then asked [him]188-adiitu , ' Whose love ? [Adiitu Courts Ivun - ade]188-adiitu But [Ademeto]187-ademeto loved [[his]187-ademeto friend]1320-his friend very much , so also did [he]187-ademeto love lyun - ade and [he]187-ademeto was sure that if [both of [them]1885-both of them]1885-both of them got .married , it would be a good thing for [Adiitu]188-adiitu and [lyun - ade]1860-lyun - ade as well . If a good thing was heading toward [Adiitu]188-adiitu , [he]187-ademeto would not divert it away , but no matter how beautiful [lyUn - ade]192-lyun - ade was , if [her]192-lyun - ade character was not good [he]187-ademeto dared not lead [[his]187-ademeto friend]1320-his friend on . [Ademeto]187-ademeto knew the kind of benefit that would emerge from such a coupling and [he]187-ademeto promised to help [[his]187-ademeto friend]1320-his friend . When [he]187-ademeto asked [him]187-ademeto if [he]187-ademeto ' had mentioned it to [the lady]1873-the lady , [he]187-ademeto replied by producing [their]1885-both of them correspondence and handed it over to [[her]1873-the lady brother]4338-her brother . When [Ademeto]187-ademeto read the letters , [he]187-ademeto reproached [Adiitu]188-adiitu , saying that nothing offended [[his]187-ademeto sister]4339-his sister more than arrogance . And the kind of arrogance that [Adiitu]188-adiitu showed in [his]188-adiitu letter was the most irksome to [lyun - ade]1860-lyun - ade . [He]187-ademeto however promised to assist [[his]187-ademeto friend]1320-his friend and warned [him]1320-his friend not to take any further steps on that matter without consulting [him]1320-his friend . [They]1885-both of them parted that day . [Ademeto]187-ademeto went [home]397-home and [Adiitu]188-adiitu went to sleep . lyim - ade saw [[her]1860-lyun - ade brother]4338-her brother the next morning . V ' [Adiitu Courts Ivun - ade]188-adiitu answered [him]188-adiitu very well . Take this one again , score this one , it is good strategy , play [the second Odu]1907-the second odu , protect [[your]1905-your home]1908-your home , chase [him]1906-him , chase [him]1906-him , chase [him]1906-him , it has scored four . ' That was how [they]4369-they played the Ayo game and when [they]4369-they resolved it , [Adiitu]188-adiitu won . [Ademeto]187-ademeto did not know when [he]0-i said , '[543-wife] It is [husband]542-husband and [wife]543-wife that defeated [me]0-i , not [Adiitu]188-adiitu alone . ' The second day after this game , [Adiitu]188-adiitu took another wrong step . Owing to the outcome of that game , [Adiitu]188-adiitu began to believe that [lyimade]190-lyimade was in love with [him]188-adiitu and that [she]190-lyimade was willing to marry [him]188-adiitu . [He]188-adiitu then sent something to [her]190-lyimade . [Ademeto]187-ademeto had told [him]188-adiitu not to take any action on the matter without first consulting [him]188-adiitu but love had enveloped [him]188-adiitu and [he]188-adiitu became [a dog fiiat]4370-a dog fiiat did not hear [the hunter]4371-the hunter 's whistle . Love enveloped [him]188-adiitu and [he]188-adiitu no longer behaved like [a normal person]4372-a normal person ; [he]188-adiitu began to act in a confused manner , just to show [his]188-adiitu love to [lyunade]196-lyunade . The list of the items [Adiitu]188-adiitu sent included six bales of aran cloth , various elepa clothes in sixes ; six of iteko , six female underwear , [six women pants]4373-six women pants , buba dress of various kinds in sixes , iborun in sixes ; same for shoes , gold - earrings , gold bangles . The Mysteries of [God]121-god When those things arrived , [Ademeto]187-ademeto was angry because [[his]187-ademeto friend]1320-his friend did not tell [him]187-ademeto beforehand and [lyun - ade]192-lyun - ade was angry because [she]192-lyun - ade did not know why [he]187-ademeto would send all these gifts to [her]192-lyun - ade . lyim - ade actually wanted to return all the items but [[her]192-lyun - ade brother]4338-her brother remembered that [[his]4338-her brother friend]1320-his friend had told [him]4338-her brother how deeply [he]4338-her brother loved [[his]4338-her brother sister]4339-his sister . [Adiitu]188-adiitu never concealed the matter from [[his]188-adiitu friend]1320-his friend and anytime [he]188-adiitu was with [Ademeto]187-ademeto alone , the matter must come up for discussion , [Ademeto]187-ademeto , [[your]187-ademeto sister]4336-your sister 's love has enveloped [me]0-i . ' [Ademeto]187-ademeto asked [[his]187-ademeto sister]4339-his sister to reply and thank [him]187-ademeto but [she]4339-his sister should let [him]187-ademeto know that [she]4339-his sister was not very pleased , in fact [she]4339-his sister was aimoyed with [Adiitu]188-adiitu , on account of the great quantity of the presents . When lyun - ade was replying , [she]4339-his sister again went beyond limits without confiding in [[her]4339-his sister brother]4338-her brother before sending the reply . This was what [she]4339-his sister wrote to [Adiitu - Olodumare]188-adiitu : 25th August , 1958 . [My]187-ademeto dear Giraffe - Neck^ The way [I]187-ademeto begin this letter must come to [you]187-ademeto as a surprise because this name , [Giraffe Neck]197-giraffe - neck , which [I]187-ademeto have called [you]187-ademeto , is not the name by which [people]379-people know [you]187-ademeto . [I]187-ademeto called [you]187-ademeto that to let [you]187-ademeto know what [you]187-ademeto are worth to [me]187-ademeto . [Some people]1518-some people seeking [your]187-ademeto favour may be eulogizing [you]187-ademeto , saying [you]187-ademeto are handsome and by so doing , [they]1518-some people dress [you]187-ademeto in a garment of pride and [you]187-ademeto accept it ; [they]1518-some people put on [you]187-ademeto the damask of vanity and [you]187-ademeto accept it . [They]1518-some people have now dressed [you]187-ademeto in the flowing garment of pride so much so that it has become an ordeal for [you]187-ademeto to know the right things to do . [[Your]187-ademeto friends]1024-your friends dare not tell [you]1917-you how [your]1917-you neck[187-ademeto]

[Adiitu Courts lyun - ade]188-adiitu is ; [[your]1917-you associates]1918-your associates dare not show [you]1917-you the kinship between [your]1917-you neck and that of the Giraffe . Now [you]1917-you have adorned it and [you]1917-you saunter around with the air of arrogance . Let [us]1919-us go to the facts . What is between [you]1917-you and [me]0-i that made [you]1917-you send [me]0-i these various gifts ? Then , why do [you]1917-you send these things to [me]0-i in sixes to signal [your]1917-you intention to attract [me]0-i in a manner of proverbs ! Please perish the thought that [I]0-i can marry [you]1917-you in future . [Me]0-i and [you]1917-you , [Adiitu]188-adiitu ? That was how [you]1917-you wrote the other day that [I]0-i should come and meet [you]1917-you at nine o'clock in the night . [I]0-i want to let [you]1917-you know that [your]1917-you money means nothing to [me]0-i . To hell with [you]1917-you , [[your]1917-you long cars]1920-your long cars land [your]1917-you six bales ofaran clothes . If [you]1917-you want to give [me]0-i a present as [a friend to [[my]0-i brother]1890-my brother]1921-a friend to my brother , [I]0-i can understand ; if [you]1917-you want to entertain [me]0-i as [a guest without any element of pride]1923-a guest without any element of pride , [I]0-i will accept . If [you]1917-you had given [me]0-i a tin of powder , [you]1917-you would have seen how appreciative of [you]1917-you [I]0-i would have been and [I]0-i would have elevated [you]1917-you before [the world]341-the world . Never forget , [Adiitu- Vlodumare]198-adiitu- vlodumare , that nothing angers [the Almighty God]1772-the almighty god more than pride . It is a sin before [God]121-god and it is written before the spirits , [Und all the thousand demons in [the forest]349-the forest]1926-und all the thousand demons in the forest abhor pride all through . A long speech leads to lying . [My]0-i speech will not end as long as [[your]1917-you long car]1928-your long car , [I]0-i am [yours]1917-you truly , lyun - ade This was the content of [lyun - ade]1860-lyun - ade 's letter to [Adiitu]188-adiitu . [Adiitu]188-adiitu took the letter without any anger and replied with another letter which showed a lot of wisdom . The letter read thus : r # # # 93

The Mysteries o f [God Opopoigbadun]199-god opopoigbadun , [Ajedubule]34-ajedubule , 25^ August , 1958 . [My]0-i dearlyun - ade , [I]0-i thank [you]1917-you immensely for [your]1917-you letter which [I]0-i received today and [I]0-i am most grateful for it . [I]0-i was initially surprised that [you]1917-you started the letter with abusive words , but after a little thought , [I]0-i was not so angry any more . In the first instance , [your]1917-you calling [me]0-i [Giraffe - Neck]197-giraffe - neck shows [me]0-i that [you]1917-you are [a good girl]1930-a good girl who says things as they are in [her]1930-a good girl mind . Also , [I]0-i have found out that the insult [you]1917-you passed on [me]0-i was to cleanse [me]0-i of the pride that [you]1917-you think [I]0-i have and not to abuse [me]0-i for its own sake . [I]0-i consider it an important thing for [[one]3876-one 's woman]1932-one 's woman to be able to speak the truth to [one]3876-one no matter how bitter it is . It is a very good thing for one to have [a womanthat one]1934-a womanthat one cantrust absolutely . [You]1917-you have said [yourself]1917-you that if [I]0-i had sent something small to [you]1917-you itwould have gladdened [your]1917-you heart but please note that [I]0-i did not send those things to [you]1917-you in order to hurt [you]1917-you . The reason is that [I]0-i love [you]1917-you very genuinely . But one thing is that [you]1917-you were [the one that mentioned the idea of marrying or not marrying]1935-the one that mentioned the idea of marrying or not marrying as [I]0-i did not write that in [my]0-i letter and [I]0-i did not engage [anybody]3883-anybody to speak to [you]1917-you on [my]0-i behalf . Yet , [my]0-i advice to [you]1917-you is that [you]1917-you should speak with caution for the sake of the future . In truth , [you]1917-you are exceedingly beautiful and endowed with a lot of wisdom . Moreover , [[your]1917-you parents]1937-your parents are the calibre of people that [one]3876-one would like to have as [in - laws]1939-in - laws because [they]1937-your parents did not pamper [you]1917-you ; [they]1937-your parents nurtured [you]1917-you very well and did not protect [you]1917-you when [you]1917-you did things that are untoward . Yet , in all these endowments of [God]121-god to [94

Adiitu Courts Ivun - ade]188-adiitu [you]1917-you , [you]1917-you do not possess the power of [God Almighty]121-god . [Adiitu Courts Ivun - ade]188-adiitu As soon as [Adiitu]188-adiitu got the letter , [he]188-adiitu did not even wait for [[his]188-adiitu driver]2021-his driver to drive [him]188-adiitu . '[2040-her] Right from that point , lyun - ade had fallen ill and [Ademeto]187-ademeto did not want to inform [Adiitu]188-adiitu because it was [Adiitu]188-adiitu and [I)ain]206-i)ain - ade - ade that were chasing each other which led to this problem . [She]2040-her became thin and being one not endowed with plenty of flesh if one saw [her]2040-her , [one]3876-one would not think of [her]2040-her as beautiful . The Mysteries of [God]107-god When [Ademeto]187-ademeto asked why [she]2209-she said it would be impossible for [both of [them]1885-both of them]1885-both of them to get married to [each other]535-each other in the future , [her]2209-she answer was that [Adiitu]188-adiitu was too proud for [her]2209-she liking . It was as if [she]2209-she knew what [Adiitu]188-adiitu had been saying about [her]2209-she ; it is this matter of pride that debarred [Adiitu]188-adiitu from telling [[his]188-adiitu friends]2212-his friends the truth about [his]188-adiitu feelings for [lyunade]196-lyunade . Nevertheless , since that day , anytime [Adiitu]188-adiitu went to [[Ademeto]187-ademeto 's house]1970-ademeto 's house , whether [he]188-adiitu found [him]188-adiitu at [home]397-home or not , lyun ­ ade would take good care of [him]188-adiitu , as if [her]2209-she love for [him]188-adiitu was increasing . If [he]188-adiitu did not meet [Ademeto]187-ademeto at [home]397-home , [she]2209-she would give [him]188-adiitu a chair and ask [him]188-adiitu to sit down while [she]2209-she went off looking for [Ademeto]187-ademeto . [She]2209-she was behaving as if [she]2209-she knew that [she]2209-she had offended [Adiitu]188-adiitu . [Adiitu]188-adiitu did not refer to the issue of marriage and [she]2209-she also behaved as if the affair with [Adiitu]188-adiitu was a forgotten one . One day , [lyun - ade]1860-lyun - ade had to travel to [another town]2217-another town by [ferry]2218-ferry . Meanwhile , a mighty whirlwind was raging . In the long run , [the ferry]2230-the ferry capsized . [The ferry]2230-the ferry was being powered by an engine but even before the whirlwind began , the engine had packed up . The Mysteries of [God]107-god When [Adiitu]188-adiitu was fully rested , [he]188-adiitu went to lyun - ade . [A man]359-a man must always act as [a man]359-a man . After [they]2250-the two of them finished eating , at about four o'clock in the evening , [Adiitu]188-adiitu walked along [the shore]2243-the shore to detect any signal that would show [him]188-adiitu where [they]2250-the two of them were . As [he]188-adiitu walked along , [he]188-adiitu saw something that looked like an engine coming on [the sea]1593-the sea and by the time the engine arrived , it was nothing other than another split piece of [[their]2250-the two of them ferry]2256-their ferry which had become entangled with weeds and ropes . When the piece got close to [him]188-adiitu , [he]188-adiitu pulled it close to [himself]188-adiitu with a stick . When [he]188-adiitu pulled one of the entanglements close to [him]188-adiitu , [he]188-adiitu found out that something else was entangled with it underneath . It was a box full of plates , soup pots , candles and matches . One of the matches was dry and [Adiitu]188-adiitu disentangled the ropes further . When [he]188-adiitu pulled another one , it turned out to be a box full of female dresses , and the third one was a box of gari , with salt and pepper . [He]188-adiitu quickly rescued these boxes so that water could not penetrate them and they were all completely dry . [lyrm - ade]204-lyrm - ade was not present at the site of this discovery , so [he]188-adiitu ran to give [her]204-lyrm - ade the good tidings . [Both of [them]1885-both of them]1885-both of them were exceedingly comforted since [they]1885-both of them now knew that [they]1885-both of them had something to bank on and by the time all these food items would have been exhausted , [they]1885-both of them should have found rescue . After reading this notice , [Adiitu]188-adiitu headed for [the place]1149-the place ; [his]188-adiitu mind told [him]188-adiitu that [they]2337-they had captured [l5om - ade]201-l5om - ade . [The road]3868-the road appeared uncatered for as it was all bushy . After walking for about one hour , [Adiitu]188-adiitu began to see [houses with thatched roofs]2347-houses with thatched roofs in patches all over but there was [nobody in sight]2348-nobody in sight and yet , [he]188-adiitu kept on walking . After a long while , [he]188-adiitu began to hear human voices and [his]188-adiitu mind told [him]188-adiitu that it must be a gathering deliberating on l5om - ade 's death , so [he]188-adiitu side - stepped into the bush to avoid being sighted . [Truly]169-truly , [he]188-adiitu soon saw [them]2337-they . [They]2337-they gathered and in front of [them]2337-they was lyun - ade , tied to a tree with oil poured all

The Mysteries of [God]121-god over [her]2349-her body and there was only five minutes remaining before setting [her]2349-her on fire so that [they]2337-they could roast [her]2349-her and feed on [her]2349-her . But [they]2337-they were performing [their]2337-they ritual , dancing around lyun - ade in accordance with [their]2337-they custom . What would [Adiitu]188-adiitu do ? [He]188-adiitu remembered that [he]188-adiitu had [his]188-adiitu matches and knew certainly that if there was fire burning from anywhere [these carnivores]2350-these carnivores would surely go and look at [the place]1149-the place . As soon as fire erupted in various places , [these carnivores]2350-these carnivores dashed to [[their]2350-these carnivores various homes]2353-their various homes immediately . Before [they]2337-they came back , [Adiitu]188-adiitu had taken a knife , cut .all the ropes used to tie l5nm - ade , pulled [her]2349-her by the arms and [they]2337-they began to run . [They]2337-they ran until [they]2337-they got to [[their]2337-they chosen abode]2354-their chosen abode . [They]2337-they were both restless as a result of this experience . How did [these carnivores]2350-these carnivores see [them]2350-these carnivores ? This question stayed on [Adiitu]188-adiitu 's mind and [he]188-adiitu decided to go to the spot where [he]188-adiitu found that notice just in case [he]188-adiitu might find extra information there that might be helpful to [them]2350-these carnivores . [Adiitu]188-adiitu walked six feet to the left and then looked to the right and [he]188-adiitu saw the hole . [Adiitu Courts Ivun - ade]188-adiitu six hours away from [them]2350-these carnivores . [Adiitu]188-adiitu then filled up the hole very well , with the help of lyun - ade . When [they]2350-these carnivores became less restless , [they]2350-these carnivores got ready to sleep . The Mysteries of [[God Esu - lehin - ibeji]102-esu - lehin - ibeji ’s brother]2471-god esu - lehin - ibeji ’s brother to wear as this event would take place in the dark . When it was night , [[Esu - lehin - ibeji]102-esu - lehin - ibeji 's brother]2472-esu - lehin - ibeji 's brother came in [Adiitu - Oloduhi^te]231-adiitu 's attires at exactly the point where [Adiitu]231-adiitu used to enter [[lyun - ade]1860-lyun - ade 's house]2474-lyun - ade 's house every night . [He]102-esu - lehin - ibeji came back in the morning at about eight o'clock . T — After [Adiitu - Olodumare]188-adiitu 's Wedding Ceremony The wedding of [Adiitu - Olodumare]188-adiitu was so merry that it was difficult to describe because [God]102-esu - lehin - ibeji blessed [the man]366-the man exceedingly . [His]366-the man wealth could not be recoimted by mere words . And [he]366-the man was such [an extremely generous man]2541-an extremely generous man . [He]366-the man spent money lavishly . [He]366-the man invited [all kings]2542-all kings with [their]2542-all kings beaded crowns . [All important chiefs]2543-all important chiefs lined up one after the other with beads on [their]2543-all important chiefs necks and [the rich men with [their]2544-the rich men with their posh cars posh cars]2544-the rich men with their posh cars were in attendance . [Poor people]2545-poor people walked on [their]2545-poor people feet to the occasion and [they]2545-poor people were .all well fed . [They]2545-poor people ate and ate and ate and [they]2545-poor people drank and drank and drank . [They]2545-poor people also danced and danced and danced and [they]2545-poor people all rejoiced mightily . [The town]464-the town was in great merriment and [people]379-people were going in and going out . In accordance with the custom of [Ajedubule town]1326-ajedubule town , such weddings were done in two phases . The first phase is for [the celebrants]2549-the celebrants to celebrate as [we]2550-we have narrated above ; the second phase is for [him]366-the man to entertain [the people]472-the people m [the home of [Enudunjuyo]57-enudunjuyo]2552-the home of enudunjuyo ( tongue is sweeter than salt ) . [The home of [Enudunjuyo]57-enudunjuyo]2552-the home of enudunjuyo is for storytelling and [anybody preparing for this kind of event]2554-anybody preparing for this kind of event must go and see [the Mogaji ( District head ) of [Enudunjuyo ward]2556-enudunjuyo ward]2555-the mogaji ( district head ) of enudunjuyo ward so that [he]366-the man would advertise the event all over [the town]464-the town and paste the information

After [Adiitu - Olodumare]188-adiitu 's Wedding Ceremony in [all public places]2558-all public places . But [he]366-the man must give [the Mogaji]96-mogaji enudunjuyo a large sum of money . There is hardly any other business in [the Enudunjuyo ward]2559-the enudunjuyo ward than to tell stories and collect money in the process . 1 ' [i.]0-i After [Adiitu]188-adiitu - [Olodumare]188-adiitu 's Wedding Ceremony There was once [a king in the olden days known as [Okonko - loju - abe]236-king okonko]4495-a king in the olden days known as okonko - loju - abe . To say that [a king]895-a king is wealthy , popular , prosperous and powerful and to say that [a king]895-a king has [numerous children]4498-numerous children . [King Alaiyeluwa Okonko]236-king okonko had [no equal]4499-no equal . [He]236-king okonko had [so many children]4500-so many children that [[his]236-king okonko children]4501-his children did not know [one another]357-one another and began to inter - marry . [He]236-king okonko had so many houses that [he]236-king okonko even bought [all the houses in [a certain town]4504-a certain town]4503-all the houses in a certain town . [One thousand and one hundred towns]4505-one thousand and one hundred towns pay tribute to [him]236-king okonko on a yearly basis . As [he]236-king okonko was wealthy and as [he]236-king okonko ruled over [many villages]4506-many villages , so was [he]236-king okonko prosperous . As numerous as [[his]236-king okonko wives]905-his wives were , [no man]1978-no man dared cross [their]905-his wives paths and [any man who crossed [their]905-his wives paths]4509-any man who crossed their paths would be killed instantly . No matter how numerous [[a man]359-a man 's wives]4511-a man 's wives are , [he]359-a man will certainly have a favourite . [Okonko]236-king okonko had a favourite and it was one of [[his]236-king okonko newly married wives]4512-his newly married wives called [Esan - mbo]237-esan - mbo . [He]236-king okonko loved [the woman]3993-the woman so much that [he]236-king okonko did not hide [his]236-king okonko love for [her]3993-the woman from [anyone]1270-anyone . This attitude did not please [the other wives]4515-the other wives , especially [the most senior wife]4516-the most senior wife . One day , [the king]769-the king traveled and [the most senior wife]4516-the most senior wife got so desperate for what to do and [she]4516-the most senior wife went to prepare a medicine which would not kill [anyone]1270-anyone but would send [the person]722-the person asleep instantly and it would take a long time for [the person]722-the person to come round . That was how [she]4516-the most senior wife was able to trap [Esan - mbo]237-esan - mbo , [[the king]769-the king ’s favourite wife]4523-the king ’s favourite wife . As [the head wife]4524-the head wife , [all other wives]4525-all other wives gave [her]4524-the head wife the respect due to [her]4524-the head wife and [she]4524-the head wife was [the one [they]4525-all other wives referred to as [mother]3940-mother]4526-the one they referred to as mother . The Mysteries of [God irresponsible ones]2605-god irresponsible ones and let 's take a stroll , [you]2604-her and - L ' That was how [Esan - mbo]237-esan - mbo followed [her]2604-her and [they]4529-they went from [house]3974-house to [house]3974-house , [compound]4532-compound to [compound]4532-compound and from [street]4534-street to [street imtil]4535-street imtil [they]4529-they arrived at [the house of [a certain elderly woman]4537-a certain elderly woman]4536-the house of a certain elderly woman . ' [Esan]237-esan - mbo answered , '[386-my mother] [[My]0-i mother]386-my mother , [I]0-i am full . ' [The woman]3993-the woman replied , '[0-i] Too full to even taste soup ? [Esan]237-esan - mbo answered again , ' Do n't bother , [[my]237-esan - mbo mother]386-my mother . '[237-esan - mbo] [She]386-my mother did not bother to ask [her]386-my mother anymore before [she]386-my mother went into [the room]607-the room and brought some soup and handed it over to [Esan - mbo]237-esan - mbo , saying , ' Taste this one , it is not much , it ca n't fill [you]237-esan - mbo up . '[386-my mother] There was no avoiding it and [she]386-my mother had hardly licked the soup that [she]386-my mother fell asleep . Immediately , [the senior wife]2608-the senior wife called out [all the servants in [the palace]977-the palace]2609-all the servants in the palace whom [she]2608-the senior wife had bribed and asked [them]2609-all the servants in the palace to tie [Esan - mbo]237-esan - mbo up with clothes and mats and put [her]237-esan - mbo inside a box which was already made for [her]237-esan - mbo and which was big enough to contain [her]237-esan - mbo . The Mysteries of [God Okonko]245-god 's cry rocked [the palace]977-the palace whenever [he]245-god did . Day Two in [Mogaii Enuduniuvo]60-mogaii enuduniuvo 's House hold on to firmly from the story [I]0-i told [you]2886-you yesterday . Today [I]0-i wish to recall before [you]2886-you the special privilege that [God Almighty]121-god endows [man]575-man with and [I]0-i want to show [you]2886-you how so great this endowment is that it has become difficult for [man]575-man to utilize it . This endowment is the power of thought which [man]575-man has above all .other creatures . Think of the animal in [the forest]349-the forest which [we]2899-we know as the antelope . If [an antelope]2900-an antelope finds the fruit that [he]2900-an antelope loves to eat , [he]2900-an antelope does not strive to learn how to plant the tree in order to have regular supply of the fruit . That is the nature of the life of other creatures ; the food that [the first turtle - dove]2901-the first turtle - dove ate is the food that all other doves that has come after still eat till today . There is no difference in the food of the partridge . The , hawk has , from time immemorial , run after [chicks]2902-chicks to feed on [them]2902-chicks , same for kolokolo which never changes [its]2903-its walking steps and the deer never jokes with leaves of okra . The bat sleeps , always with its head bent down and the owl hoots about all night through . The squirrel goes about entangled to the epithets ; [the Edun]255-the edun and [the donkey]2904-the donkey , [the chimpanzee]2905-the chimpanzee and the monkey : all of [them]2906-their make the trees [their]2906-their habitat and [they]2906-their jump from one tree to the other all [their]2906-their lives . ■ But [hum^ beings]2907-hum^ beings ! [Human beings]684-human beings ! [Human beings]684-human beings ! [Human beings]684-human beings are restless ! Constant thmking makes [human beings]684-human beings restless . The Mysteries of [God]121-god keeps seeking greater heights , no matter how high [his]257-man present position . [Man]257-man always looks for better ways of doing things to derive greater fulfillment . [No one running after money]2914-no one running after money ever feels that [he]2914-no one running after money has had enough and if [a man]359-a man is doing business , [he]359-a man will want the business to keep growing forever . This is the cause of discontent in [the world]341-the world . [One]3876-one can look at wealth in another way , that is to be able to feel satisfied with whatever position [one]3876-one is by simply remaining unruffled whether [one]3876-one attains a higher status or not . Satisfaction will come if [one]3876-one is not greedy in seeking greater wealth and greater height ; to remain content with what [one]3876-one has without feeling envious of the attainment of [others]4191-others ; this is the kind of contentment [we]2899-we are talking about . [A man]359-a man can be content with what [he]359-a man is such that even if [he]359-a man lacks in other ways , it will not matter to [him]359-a man nor affect the way [others]4191-others look at [him]359-a man . However , if [one]3876-one is content with what [he]3876-one has but looks for ways of improving upon it , it still amounts to contentment . Discontentment with money is the greatest of all and [some people]1518-some people can do just anything to have money . [We]2899-we lie if [we]2899-we say that money is not important in [the world]341-the world , but there is a limit to the importance of moriey . Money is neither as important as [human beings]684-human beings nor as important as [one]3876-one 's soul . [They]1512-each person then distributed bags known as Apo eje ( bags of blood ) among [them]1512-each person . The bags were completely decorated with feathers . The bag was made of rubber . After that , [they]1512-each person distributed human skulls and the skulls were up to two hundred m number . When [they]1512-each person cornpleted this ritual , [the Chairman]3052-the chairman rang the bell for food . Day Two in [Mo^aii Enuduniuvo 's House]61-mo^aii enuduniuvo 's house if [such people]1519-such people have curses on [their]1519-such people heads and [people like that]3332-people like that love money more than [[their]1519-such people children]3333-their children . Nine . ' f Day Three in [the Home of [Enudunjuyo]57-enudunjuyo]2552-the home of enudunjuyo On the third day that [people]379-people have been assembling in [the compoimd of [Enudrmjuyo]66-enudrmjuyo]4809-the compoimd of enudrmjuyo , [the Mogaji of the House]4810-the mogaji of the house started speaking thus : [Citizens of [Ajedubule]34-ajedubule]4811-citizens of ajedubule , [you]4811-citizens of ajedubule will find that on each day of [your]4811-citizens of ajedubule visit to [this place]4812-this place , [I]281-enuduniuyo have spoken on certain characters ; traits of [human beings]684-human beings , and [I]281-enuduniuyo have exemplified each trait with a story . Today , [I]281-enuduniuyo want to begin with a riddle and [I]281-enuduniuyo want [you]4811-citizens of ajedubule to resolve the riddle and it is the meaning of the riddle that will provide the subject for today 's talk . One day , [a woman]372-a woman went to look for a deadly poison which could instantly kill [whoever tasted it]4815-whoever tasted it and [she]372-a woman poured the medicine in a spring and [two people]2275-two people died after drinking the water . [Everybody]475-everybody then knew that the water had been poisoned and therefore [people]379-people stopped fetching water from [the stream]4819-the stream . What kind of character can [we]4820-we compare this poison with ? When [he]281-enuduniuyo spoke this way , [nobody]462-nobody was able to resolve the riddle and after a while [nobody]462-nobody could detect the kind of poison it was , [he]281-enuduniuyo told [them]379-people it was called ingratitude . [Anyone who was shown kindness and did[281-enuduniuyo]

Day Three in [the Home of [Enuduniuyo]281-enuduniuyo]3334-the home of enuduniuyo]4823-anyone who was shown kindness and did day three in the home of enuduniuyo not appreciate it had blocked the way for [others]4191-others ; [that person]1667-that person is a deadly poison among [people]379-people and [nobody]462-nobody would want to show kindness to [such a person]3339-such a person or [any other human being]3340-any other human being as a result of [his]3341-his or [her]3342-her imgrateful character . [An ingrate]3343-an ingrate brings unhappiness for [people]379-people , [he]3343-an ingrate is [a wicked person]3345-a wicked person ; [an evil person who wears human flesh but has the head of an animal]3346-an evil person who wears human flesh but has the head of an animal . [They]3347-they are the salt that has gone sour in [the world]341-the world ; they are scorpions among [humans]572-humans ; [they]3347-they have become green snakes in green grass who are not fit for decent company . [They]3347-they are [not well bred people]3350-not well bred people ; [they]3347-they are thorny epithets in the grove and in the imdergrowth ; [they]3347-they will reap the reward of [their]3347-they handiwork on [earth]3889-earth and if [they]3347-they do not reap it on [earth]3889-earth , certainly [they]3347-they will be found guilty before [the advocates of [God]121-god in [heaven]319-heaven]3353-the advocates of god in heaven . Listen to this story which will clarify this riddle . There was once [a man]359-a man with [two wives]3356-two wives and [each wife]3357-each wife bore [him]359-a man [a child]558-a child each and [each child]3359-each child was [male]3360-male . [The man]366-the man named [the first child]3362-the first child , [Obedini]287-obedini and [the second child]3363-the second child , [Obedeji]288-obedeji and [he]366-the man lived in [the town of [Ogbon - aiye]67-ogbon - aiye]3364-the town of ogbon - aiye . [The two children]3365-the two children grew up and became [traders]3366-traders . No sooner had [they]3365-the two children started trading than [[their]3365-the two children father]3367-their father died leaving one thousand poimds for each of [them]3365-the two children . [Obedini]287-obedini remained in [the town]464-the town and continued with [his]366-the man trade which became so prosperous that [he]366-the man married [two wives]3356-two wives within six months but did not marry [any more wives]3370-any more wives after these two . [Obedim]289-obedim was six years older than [Obedeji]288-obedeji . When [he]366-the man married [[his]366-the man two wives]3371-his two wives , [Obedini]287-obedini had no idea of what [women]492-women were like . The Mysteries of [God]121-god all the while , [he]366-the man loved [her]4254-the first wife exceedingly because [she]4254-the first wife was faithful to [him]366-the man and [he]366-the man never saw [her]4254-the first wife with [any other man]3375-any other man . [The second wife]3376-the second wife bore [many children]3377-many children . In fact , [she]3376-the second wife already had [three children]3378-three children while [the other wife]3379-the other wife had none ; [she]3376-the second wife did not even get pregnant by accident . After some time , [the childless wife]3380-the childless wife 's love for [[her]3380-the childless wife husband]554-her husband began to reduce but [the man]366-the man did not suspect anything . [She]3380-the childless wife used to sell things for [[her]3380-the childless wife husband]554-her husband within [the town]464-the town but later , [she]3380-the childless wife took permission to carry the wares to [other towns]563-other towns . [Obedini]287-obedini did not know what was happening and [he]366-the man showed so much love to [her]3380-the childless wife that [she]3380-the childless wife had no reason to start a quarrel . In fact , [Obedini]287-obedini went to the extent of pounding yams for [her]3380-the childless wife to eat , grinding pepper for [her]3380-the childless wife soup and fetching water for [her]3380-the childless wife to bathe . The Mysteries of [God]121-god at dusk , it can not stand where [you]2277-my dear stand ; [I]0-i look at the feathers ofokin , none of [them]3464-them come near [you]2277-my dear in terms of beauty ; [I]0-i look at the flowering plants , none of them equals [you]2277-my dear , so also is [the cattle - egret]3465-the cattle - egret , and the fresh pod of the corn ; even with the brightness of the noon - sun , none is as white as the whiteness of the teeth in [your]2277-my dear mouth . Day Three in [the Home of [Enuduniuyo Ogbon - aiye]72-enuduniuyo ogbon - aiye]3483-the home of enuduniuyo ogbon - aiye where [Ami]290-ami and [[her]290-ami husband]554-her husband [Obedini]287-obedini resided . [He]366-the man arrived at [Ogbon - aiye]67-ogbon - aiye at about nine o'clock and parked [his]366-the man lorry somewhere and took a stroll . When it was exactly one o'clock in the dead of night , [he]366-the man picked the corpse and headed for [[Obedini]287-obedini 's backyard]3485-obedini 's backyard , gently deposited [it]3486-it there and went [his]366-the man way . [People]379-people started shouting and went to [[the king]769-the king 's palace]2487-the king 's palace and [[Obedini]287-obedini 's enemies]3492-obedini 's enemies went and called [the police]4091-the police . The Mysteries o f God peiform an autopsy and explain the cause of [the man]366-the man 's death . [Nobody]462-nobody suspected that [Onibaje - Oktmrin]295-onibaje - oktmrin who was chasing after [Ami]290-ami could be responsible for such a hideous act . Day Three in [the Home]2742-the home ofEnuduniuvo [Obedini]287-obedini was visibly shaken and [he]2850-your husband did not think twice before handing over the letter to [[his]2850-your husband brother]2466-his brother , [Obedeji]288-obedeji and [they]3528-they both went to [the police station]2020-the police station . When [they]3528-they handed over the letter to [the police]4091-the police , [they]3528-they dispatched [plain clothes men]3536-plain clothes men to go to [the town]464-the town where [Onibaje - Okunrin]293-onibaje - okunrin resided . [They]3528-they went straight to [[the man]366-the man 's house]2973-the man 's house , and lo and behold , [they]3528-they were pleased because as soon as [they]3528-they got to the front of [the house]405-the house [they]3528-they saw [a lorry]3541-a lorry and on enquiry , [they]3528-they were informed that [the vehicle]1564-the vehicle belonged to [the man]366-the man . [They]3528-they found out about [his]366-the man occupation and [they]3528-they were told that [he]366-the man was [a driver]3544-a driver . [They]3528-they began to inspect the body of [the vehicle]1564-the vehicle to see , if [they]3528-they could find any evidence that would show [them]3528-they that it was used to kill [the man that was brought to [[Obedini]287-obedini 's house]3488-obedini 's house]3546-the man that was brought to obedini 's house . Truly , even though it was about four days after the incident , there was blood on the silencer imder [the vehicle]1564-the vehicle where even [the driver]353-the driver would n't have noticed . To make a long story short , [they]3528-they arrested [Orubaje- bkunrin]296-orubaje- bkunrin on the spot and put [him]296-orubaje- bkunrin in handcuffs . In the end , [Onibaje - Okunrin]293-onibaje - okunrin was convicted , given a death sentence and hanged . When news got to [Ami]290-ami that [[her]290-ami lover]3460-her lover had been killed , [she]290-ami did not eat throughout the day but it did not show on [her]290-ami face that [she]290-ami was mourning [anybody]3883-anybody . Soon after this incident . [Ami]290-ami went to [Ibaje - ode]73-ibaje - ode again . [She]290-ami promised to return on the third day . r # # # 197

The Mysteries o f [God]121-god After three days , [she]290-ami did not come back , nor did [she]290-ami return on the fourth day . On the fifth day , [[her]290-ami husband]554-her husband set out to look for [her]290-ami . May [God]121-god not make this kind of thing [our]3569-our portion in life . Day Three in [the Home of [Enudunjuyo]57-enudunjuyo]2552-the home of enudunjuyo and [he]288-obedeji became [a sorrowful man]3652-a sorrowful man . The Mysteries of [God]102-esu - lehin - ibeji]3676-the deck of mpupiijii.i i. the mysteries of god [the ship]1567-the ship could fall into [the ocean]1966-the ocean without [anybody]3883-anybody being aware of it . [They]3663-they planned to stay long on the trip so that when [they]3663-they got back to [town]881-town , [they]3663-they would say that it had been long since [they]3663-they parted company with [Obedeji]288-obedeji . What [they]3663-they did not know was that [Obedeji]288-obedeji was [a swimmer]3686-a swimmer . [He]288-obedeji had learnt how to swim on [his]288-obedeji numerous trips and since [he]288-obedeji did not live for long periods in [[their]3663-they town]562-their town , [they]3663-they were not aware of this fact . [He]288-obedeji began to swim and as [he]288-obedeji was getting tired , [he]288-obedeji got to [one island]3688-one island . [That island]3689-that island was full of numerous goods . It was as if [robbers]1803-robbers used [the place]1149-the place as [[their]1803-robbers warehouse]3692-their warehouse . [He]288-obedeji saw one box and when [he]288-obedeji opened it , [he]288-obedeji foxmd that it was glowing red with a load of poimd sterling and [he]288-obedeji opened another which was filled with gold coins . There must have been a shipwreck during which a flood blew so many minerals unto [that island]3689-that island . In [[the city of]3775-the city of [London]43-london , which is [the biggest city]3777-the biggest city in [the world]341-the world with [thousands of doctors]3779-thousands of doctors]3776-the city of london , which is the biggest city in the world with thousands of doctors , [many couples]3780-many couples have been tested by [doctors]3781-doctors and declared fertile but did not have [children]3973-children . s The Mysteries of [God]121-god is a translation of D. 0 . [Fagunwa]92-fagunwa 's [Adiitu Olodumare]188-adiitu which was originally written in [Yoruba]10-yoruba . This captivating story revolves around the life of [a man called [Adiitu]188-adiitu who had a humble background but eventually prospered through very mysterious means . [He]188-adiitu also passed through various trials and difficulties in the course of [his]188-adiitu life]3850-a man called adiitu who had a humble background but eventually prospered through very mysterious means . he also passed through various trials and difficulties in the course of his life . This book is filled with different sub - stories that teach morals , and exposes different ills in [the society]3851-the society . It is also rich in parables , wise sayings and folk songs . The underlying lesson in this book , however , is that [God]121-god works in mysterious ways . [A prolific playwright]3852-a prolific playwright , [novelist]3853-novelist , [poet]3854-poet , [literary and theatre scholar]3855-literary and theatre scholar . [Professor Olu Obafemi]91-olu obafemi has published fourteen scholarly books , fifteen creative books ( plays , poetry and a novel ) and over sixty journal articles in national and international outlets . [He]91-olu obafemi has been [a Professor of English and Dramatic Literature of [the University of llorin]86-the university of llorin]3856-a professor of english and dramatic literature of the university of llorin since October 1,1990 . [Professor Obafemi]91-olu obafemi was [the Chairman , Board of Directors of the National Commission for Museums and Monuments]3857-the chairman , board of directors of the national commission for museums and monuments ; President of [the Association of Nigerian Authors ( ANA]3858-the association of nigerian authors ( ana ) ; member of [the Board of Trustees , The Nigerian Book Fair Trust]3859-the board of trustees , the nigerian book fair trust ; and [he]91-olu obafemi is [the current National Chairman of [the Nigerian Reproduction Rights Society of [Nigeria]88-nigeria]87-the nigerian reproduction rights society of nigeria ( REPRONIG )]3860-the current national chairman of the nigerian reproduction rights society of nigeria ( repronig ) . [Professor Obafemi]91-olu obafemi is [a Fellow of the Society of Nigerian Theatre Artists ( SONTA]3861-a fellow of the society of nigerian theatre artists ( sonta ) ; Fellow , Association of [Nigerian Authors]3862-nigerian authors ( [ANA]3858-the association of nigerian authors ( ana ) ; and Fellow of [the Nigerian Academy of Letters ( FNAL )]3863-the nigerian academy of letters ( fnal ) . [He]91-olu obafemi is currently [the Director of Research of [the National Institute for Policy and Strategic Studies]3865-the national institute for policy and strategic studies]3864-the director of research of the national institute for policy and strategic studies , [Kuru]89-kuru , [Plateau State]90-plateau state . [His]91-olu obafemi play , Ogidi Mandate , won the 2011 ANA / J.P.CIark Prize for Drama while [his]91-olu obafemi poetry . Illuminations , got an Honourable mention for ANA/ Okara Prize for 2010 .
